DOC.brief_summary: This post coital test study Phase I multi-center , randomize , crossover , non-significant risk device study carry two clinical sites/centers . The product test SILCS diaphragm 3 % Nonoxynol-9 Gel ( N-9 ) ( spermicide ) , SILCS diaphragm ContraGel , SILCS diaphragm alone . Participants randomized order product use , goal 10 participant complete study .
DOC.brief_title: Postcoital Testing Study SILCS Diaphragm Used With 3 % N-9 Gel , ContraGel , No Gel
DOC.detailed_description: Each participant see approximately nine visit , period 6-8 month , contact approximately 7 day final visit . Volunteers consent Visit 1 undergo procedure confirm eligible continue study . Each participant undergo four postcoital test ( PCT ) cycle : 1 . The first PCT cycle baseline cycle , do without use product , order demonstrate participant 's ability undergo normal ovulatory event produce receptive , midcycle cervical mucus . The partner 's ability produce motile sperm capable penetrate cervical mucus also evaluate cycle . 2 . Test PCT cycle carry subsequent menstrual cycle use either SILCS diaphragm 3 % N-9 , SILCS diaphragm ContraGel , SILCS diaphragm alone follow sequence randomize treatment . Cycles may need repeat depend characteristic cervical mucus number sperm find vaginal pool endocervical specimen .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 1845 year , inclusive 2 . General good health , volunteer history per investigator judgment 3 . History regular menstrual cycle 2435 day ( inclusive ) , volunteer report 4 . History Pap smear followup consistent standard medical practice outline Study Manual willing undergo Pap smear Visit 1 5 . Willing abstain intercourse use vaginal product require protocol 6 . Willing use nonspermicidal , lubricate condom first day menstrual cycle 72 hour expect midcycle 7 . In mutually monogamous relationship least last four month male partner : 7a . Is least 18 year old ; 7b . Has know risk STIs ; 7c . Is willing able comply protocol requirement include sexual activity/ abstinence condom use requirement ; 7d . Can engage vaginal intercourse participant , without condom , specify protocol 8 . Protected pregnancy female tubal sterilization 9 . Vaginal cervical anatomy , opinion investigator , lend easy genital tract sample collection 10 . Willing give voluntary consent , sign inform consent form comply study procedure require protocol 1 . History hysterectomy 2 . Vasectomy male partner 3 . Sterility know history sperm dysfunction male partner 4 . Currently pregnant within two calendar month last pregnancy outcome . Note : If recently pregnant must least two spontaneous menses since pregnancy outcome 5 . Current use hormonal contraceptive copper IUD , use DepoProvera last 120 day 6 . Currently breastfeed breastfed infant last two month , plan breastfeed course study 7 . Significant gynecological abnormality ( include abnormal vaginal bleeding excessive vaginal discharge ) 8 . Device appropriately fit volunteer , determine clinician 9 . Inability insert , position , and/or remove study device , clinician volunteer 10 . History sensitivity/allergy 3 % N9 , latex , ingredient ContraGel , silicone , either volunteer male partner 11 . In last six month , either volunteer male partner diagnose treat STI pelvic inflammatory disease . Note : Women history genital herpes condylomata asymptomatic least six month may consider eligibility 12 . Positive test Trichomonas vaginalis , Neisseria gonorrhea Chlamydia trachomatis 13 . Deep epithelial genital finding abrasion , ulceration , laceration , vesicle suspicious sexually transmit infection 14 . Positive test HIV 15 . Chronic acute vulvar vaginal symptom ( pain , irritation , spot , etc . ) 16 . Known current drug alcohol abuse could impact study compliance 17 . Participation investigational trial within last 30 day plan participation investigational trial study 18 . History gynecological procedure ( include genital piercing ) external genitalia , vagina cervix within last 14 day 19 . Abnormal find laboratory physical examination social medical condition either volunteer male partner , opinion investigator , would make participation study unsafe would complicate interpretation data
